availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Montgomery County, Tennessee, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth Holland Farthing in Robertson County, Tennessee, on January 10, 1846. Father of Marcellus Farthing, Silvester Farthing, S. E. Farthing, Vianna Farthing, and H. E. Farthing. Farmer in Robertson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County, Tennessee, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Robertson County, District 2, p. 13B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Montgomery County, Clarksville, p. 402.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Lindles Precinct, p. 309B.
"Peter Farthing (1826-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial 25793965, accessed January 3, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25793965.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Robertson County, 1878 - 1886: Marriages 3, p. 132.
